title: Stephen Fry and the Gutenburg Pess
content:
Has anyone seen all of the BBC 4 programme with Stephen Fry, about a guy building a copy of the Gutenburg Press?  
It must have been on four or five times now, and I just keep seeing the last five minutes - its on now again, but its nearly over.

 [‹ as I wander through the graveyard](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232605/http:/typophile.com/node/45298 "Go to previous forum topic") [Typographic Signs in Need of Professional Help. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232605/http:/typophile.com/node/20998 "Go to next forum topic")
author: steve_p

comments.content:
I have seen it.

You can [watch it on BBC iPlayer](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232605/http:/www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/page/item/b009wynj.shtml?q=stephen+fry&start=1&scope=iplayersearch&go=Find+Programmes&version_pid=b009wy81) if you are in the UK
I did try the “iPlayer”, just to realize that it doesn’t work outside of the UK. BBC, cultural protectionism is barbarie!
I saw it on YouTube about a month ago, but it seems to have been removed.

it’s not so much about “cultural protectionism” as it is about UK residents paying an annual TV licence fee.  
We get iPlayer because we pay for it.

I imagine that eventually, non-UK countries will get paid access via stores like iTunes.

“It must have been on four or five times now”

...as have threads about this programme! LOL
